required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Compare American Heart Association (AHA) and Simple (SIM)Method to Give Adenosine to Treat Supra-ventricular Tachycardia (SVT)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial of the Standard Versus a Simplified Adenosine Administration Method in the Treatment of Adult Patients With Supra- Ventricular Tachycardia (SVT)

brief_summary.textblock: Study to compare non inferiority of giving adenosine with the simplified method vs the AHA method

detailed_description.textblock: tle: A randomised controlled trial of the standard versus a simplified adenosine administration method in the treatment of adult patients with supra- ventricular tachycardia (SVT

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Patients With First Dose Successful Termination of the Supraventricular Tachycardia to a Sinus Rhythm of Less Than 140 With the AHA Versus a Simplified Method of Adenosine Administration
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is the rhythm of conversion to a sinus rhythm less than 140 beat per minute.

arm_group.description: Method of giving adenosine at 6mg then 12mg repeated twice to abort svt Intervention is giving the drug in a simplified method mixing it with 20 ml saline as a whole flush
Giving adenosine Ising the recommended AHA two syringe method

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Svt
- normal blood pressure
- normal mentation
- Give consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- recent coffee
- Allergy to adenosine
- Asthma
- cardiac operations

results_reference.citation: Orejarena LA, Vidaillet H Jr, DeStefano F, Nordstrom DL, Vierkant RA, Smith PN, Hayes JJ. Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia in the general population. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1998 Jan;31(1):150-7.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Intervention/SIM Group
group.description: Giving adenosine 6mg premixed with saline flush to a total of 20ml and giving it as a rapid flush, then same method repeated twice with 12 mg adenosine if the SVT does not convert The group evaluated was the SIM or intervention group

group.title: Control/AHA Group
group.description: Giving adenosine as 6mg in one syringe with a separate syringe with 20ml saline flush using a three way stop cock to connect the syringes. Adenosine is given first as a rapid push followed by another rapid flush from the saline. The same method to be repeated twice with 12 mg adenosine if the SVT does not convert after 10-15 seconds The group evaluated was the AHA or control group

group.title: Simplified Method
group.description: Method of giving adenosine at 6mg then 12mg repeated twice to abort svt Intervention is giving the drug in a simplified method mixing it with 20 ml saline as a whole flush Adenosine: A vial of adenosine with 6mg

group.title: AHA Method
group.description: Giving adenosine Ising the recommended AHA two syringe method Adenosine: A vial of adenosine with 6mg

measure.title: Race (NIH/OMB)
measure.description: The races were African, Asian, Coloured

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: The Number of Patients With First Dose Successful Termination of the Supraventricular Tachycardia to a Sinus Rhythm of Less Than 140 With the AHA Versus a Simplified Method of Adenosine Administration
outcome.description: The primary outcome is the rhythm of conversion to a sinus rhythm less than 140 beat per minute.

group.title: Intervention Group
group.description: Method of giving adenosine at 6mg then 12mg repeated twice to abort svt Intervention is giving the drug in a simplified method mixing it with 20 ml saline as a whole flush Adenosine: A vial of adenosine with 6mg

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Giving adenosine Ising the recommended AHA two syringe method Adenosine: A vial of adenosine with 6mg

measure.title: The Number of Patients With First Dose Successful Termination of the Supraventricular Tachycardia to a Sinus Rhythm of Less Than 140 With the AHA Versus a Simplified Method of Adenosine Administration
measure.description: The primary outcome is the rhythm of conversion to a sinus rhythm less than 140 beat per minute.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that the AHA method is inferior to the SIM method but not lower than a pre calculated noninferiority delta of -0.12 (-12 %) and a 95% one sided confidence interval. Only 33 (instead of 151 for a power of 95%) patients could be enrolled with 25 in the SIM and 8 in the AHA arms, which resulted in an estimated power test of 59.08%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin or delta was calculated as -0.12(-12%)

reported_events.desc: There were no major adverse events

group.title: Intervention Group

group.description: Giving adenosine Ising the recommended AHA two syringe method Adenosine: A vial of adenosine with 6mg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
